events.name: Shenzhen enforces lockdowns due to Covid cases
events.wd_label: Shenzhen enforces lockdowns due to Covid cases
events.wd_description: Shenzhen, China, shut down the world's largest electronics market and suspended public transport in response to a small number of Covid cases, enforcing neighborhood-wide lockdowns.
events.description: Shenzhen, China, shut down the world's largest electronics market and suspended public transport in response to a small number of Covid cases, enforcing neighborhood-wide lockdowns.

events.name: lockdown of Huaqianbei market
events.wd_description: Huaqianbei, a busy shopping area with thousands of stalls selling electronic components, was placed under a mandatory four-day lockdown.
events.description: Huaqianbei, a busy shopping area with thousands of stalls selling electronic components, was placed under a mandatory four-day lockdown.

events.name: zero-Covid measures
events.wd_description: China continues to enforce stringent zero-Covid measures, with Shenzhen implementing strict lockdowns in response to Covid cases.
events.description: China continues to enforce stringent zero-Covid measures, with Shenzhen implementing strict lockdowns in response to Covid cases.

events.name: suspension of businesses
events.wd_description: Except for supermarkets, pharmacies, and hospitals, all businesses in the affected area were shut down through Thursday, with restaurant dining suspended and only takeaways allowed.
events.description: Except for supermarkets, pharmacies, and hospitals, all businesses in the affected area were shut down through Thursday, with restaurant dining suspended and only takeaways allowed.

events.name: identification of high-risk areas
events.wd_description: Dozens of neighborhoods across Shenzhen were identified as high-risk areas and placed under strict lockdown orders.
events.description: Dozens of neighborhoods across Shenzhen were identified as high-risk areas and placed under strict lockdown orders.

events.name: President Biden's address at the Arab summit
events.wd_label: President Biden's address at the Arab summit
events.wd_description: President Joe Biden addressed the Arab summit, affirming the United States' commitment to being an active partner in the Middle East and urging leaders to view human rights as a catalyst for economic and social change.
events.description: President Joe Biden addressed the Arab summit, affirming the United States' commitment to being an active partner in the Middle East and urging leaders to view human rights as a catalyst for economic and social change.

events.name: Biden's commitment
events.wd_description: President Joe Biden emphasized that the United States would remain an active and engaged partner in the Middle East, highlighting the importance of human rights.
events.description: President Joe Biden emphasized that the United States would remain an active and engaged partner in the Middle East, highlighting the importance of human rights.

events.name: focus of Biden's Middle East trip
events.wd_label: focus of Biden's Middle East trip
events.wd_description: Biden's first trip to the Middle East as President focused on the summit with six Gulf states, Egypt, Jordan, and Iraq, downplaying a meeting with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.
events.description: Biden's first trip to the Middle East as President focused on the summit with six Gulf states, Egypt, Jordan, and Iraq, downplaying a meeting with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.

events.name: goal of the Saudi Arabia visit
events.wd_label: goal of the Saudi Arabia visit
events.wd_description: Biden's visit to Saudi Arabia aimed to strike a deal on oil production to help reduce gasoline prices and combat inflation.
events.description: Biden's visit to Saudi Arabia aimed to strike a deal on oil production to help reduce gasoline prices and combat inflation.

events.name: Damage to Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant
events.wd_label: Damage to Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant
events.wd_description: The Ukrainian nuclear agency reported that part of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, controlled by Russia, was damaged by Russian rockets, though no radiation leak is suspected.
events.description: The Ukrainian nuclear agency reported that part of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant, controlled by Russia, was damaged by Russian rockets, though no radiation leak is suspected.

events.name: Enerhoatom report
events.wd_description: Enerhoatom reported that a nitrogen-oxygen unit and a high-voltage power line at the Zaporizhzhia plant were damaged by Russian rockets.
events.description: Enerhoatom reported that a nitrogen-oxygen unit and a high-voltage power line at the Zaporizhzhia plant were damaged by Russian rockets.

events.name: Russian and Ukrainian blame
events.wd_description: Russian-appointed local officials blamed Ukraine for shelling, while Ukraine blamed Russian forces for launching rockets at civilian areas from the plant site.
events.description: Russian-appointed local officials blamed Ukraine for shelling, while Ukraine blamed Russian forces for launching rockets at civilian areas from the plant site.

events.name: plant control and operations
events.wd_description: Russia seized the Zaporizhzhia plant in March but kept Ukrainian employees to continue operations; the plant consists of six pressurized water reactors and stores radioactive waste.
events.description: Russia seized the Zaporizhzhia plant in March but kept Ukrainian employees to continue operations; the plant consists of six pressurized water reactors and stores radioactive waste.

events.name: UK defense ministry statement
events.wd_description: The UK's defense ministry stated that Russia has used the area around the Zaporizhzhia plant to minimize the risk of attack by Ukrainian forces due to its protected status.
events.description: The UK's defense ministry stated that Russia has used the area around the Zaporizhzhia plant to minimize the risk of attack by Ukrainian forces due to its protected status.

events.name: EV battery supply chain expansion
events.wd_description: Ford is expanding its EV battery supply chain to support its goals of producing 600,000 EVs annually by late 2023 and more than 2 million by 2026.
events.description: Ford is expanding its EV battery supply chain to support its goals of producing 600,000 EVs annually by late 2023 and more than 2 million by 2026.

events.name: sourcing battery capacity
events.wd_description: Ford has secured contracts for 60 GWh of annual battery capacity to support its 600,000 EV run rate and sourced 70% of the battery capacity needed to support its 2026 goal of over 2 million EVs annually.
events.description: Ford has secured contracts for 60 GWh of annual battery capacity to support its 600,000 EV run rate and sourced 70% of the battery capacity needed to support its 2026 goal of over 2 million EVs annually.

events.name: t: agreements with CATL
events.wd_description: CATL will provide LFP battery packs for Mustang Mach-E and F-150 Lightning models, with plans to explore further cooperation for global battery supply.
events.description: CATL will provide LFP battery packs for Mustang Mach-E and F-150 Lightning models, with plans to explore further cooperation for global battery supply.

events.name: t: agreements with LGES
events.wd_description: LGES has doubled its capacity at its Wroclaw, Poland, facility to support NCM cell production for Mustang Mach-E and E-Transit models.
events.description: LGES has doubled its capacity at its Wroclaw, Poland, facility to support NCM cell production for Mustang Mach-E and E-Transit models.

events.name: t: agreements with SK On
events.wd_description: SK On has scaled up NCM cell production in Atlanta and Hungary to support F-150 Lightning and E-Transit models.
events.description: SK On has scaled up NCM cell production in Atlanta and Hungary to support F-150 Lightning and E-Transit models.

events.name: securing raw materials
events.wd_description: Ford has sourced key raw materials for batteries, including nickel and lithium, through agreements with various global partners.
events.description: Ford has sourced key raw materials for batteries, including nickel and lithium, through agreements with various global partners.

events.name: t: nickel agreements
events.wd_description: Ford has signed MOUs with Vale Canada, PT Vale Indonesia, Huayou Cobalt, and BHP for nickel supply.
events.description: Ford has signed MOUs with Vale Canada, PT Vale Indonesia, Huayou Cobalt, and BHP for nickel supply.

events.name: t: lithium agreements
events.wd_description: Ford has secured lithium contracts with Liontown Resources, Rio Tinto, ioneer, Compass Minerals, and Syrah Resources.
events.description: Ford has secured lithium contracts with Liontown Resources, Rio Tinto, ioneer, Compass Minerals, and Syrah Resources.

events.name: expanding production facilities
events.wd_description: Ford is increasing its battery production capacity through new facilities and joint ventures.
events.description: Ford is increasing its battery production capacity through new facilities and joint ventures.

events.name: t: BlueOval SK joint venture
events.wd_description: Ford and SK On have formed the BlueOval SK joint venture to build three battery plants in Kentucky and Tennessee.
events.description: Ford and SK On have formed the BlueOval SK joint venture to build three battery plants in Kentucky and Tennessee.

events.name: t: Turkey joint venture
events.wd_description: Ford has signed an MOU with SK On and Koç Holdings to create a joint venture in Turkey for expanded battery capacity.
events.description: Ford has signed an MOU with SK On and Koç Holdings to create a joint venture in Turkey for expanded battery capacity.

events.name: t: North America localization
events.wd_description: Ford plans to localize 40 GWh of LFP capacity in North America starting in 2026.
events.description: Ford plans to localize 40 GWh of LFP capacity in North America starting in 2026.
